title: USS Liberty: Still Classified USS Liberty Documents Seen by X User @mdvtfan
tags: israeli attack on the uss liberty

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Still Classified USS Liberty Documents Seen by X User @mdvtfan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the Israel Defense Force attacked our ship on June 8, 1967, and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.[https://ussliberty.org]

A user on X (formerly Twitter) is a DoD Contractor at Ft. Meade. He posted a comment telling us he saw still classified documents related to the attack on our ship.

His X id is @mdvtfan.

I’ve included screenshots of the relevant comments he made on X.

The URLs of his comments are https://x.com/mdvtfan/status/1964101066837946589 and https://x.com/mdvtfan/status/1964130923789664600

We ask that the still-classified documents related to the attack on our ship be declassified and released to us.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors
